text: Keg at Ratebeer Best Beer Festival. 31/01/2016. A black / caramel brown coloured pour with a loose dirty tan head. Aroma is tangy black malts, malt loaf, plastic, Flavour is composed of burnt toast, toasted malts, plastic and some spicy nobel hop to tangy finish. P{alate is semi sweet, moderate carbonation, grainy. decent.

Keg at RB Best, 31/01/16. 
Black topped with a dirty tan swirl.
Nose is light black peppery spice, raisens, cocoa rub, biscuit, dark fruits.
Taste comprises roasted malts, raisen, biscuit, sultana, light salt, liquorice stick, charring.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, drying close.
Super solid offering for the style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Tap at Ratebeer Best. Pours a dark brown with small beige head. The aroma is roast, dark fruit, spice. Medium body, dark fruit, peaty, spice, ash, light dry finish,very good.

On tap at ratebeer best festival. Pours out a muddy dark brown almost black topped with a small head. Nose is roast light smoke ash notes some soy tobacco. Taste is more of the light ash notes a touch of smoke tobacco grassy earthy hops and a nice end.

Draft. Blackish beer with a light tan head. Light nutty aroma with with roast and caramel. Light roast and light darker malt flavor with caramel. Medium bodied. Caramel and light roast lingers with light mineral notes.

RB best. Tap, poured by Andy. 
Rich, malty nose of cocoa, soy sauce, a bit of fruit. Smooth, lightly fruity flaovr, lovely chocolate, notes of soy and coffee. Good stuff.

Draught at RateBeer Best festival. Poured by Jesus of Franconia. Opaque black liquid with minimal light tan head. Aroma of light licorice, light ash, bread and light raw sugar. Taste is very light sweet and light sour with notes of light licorice, light ash and bread. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Quite nice!

On tap at RateBeer Best. It pours black with a small, bubbly tan head. The aroma has some intense tobacco, a little smoke and some herbal notes. Kind of dank. The flavor is strong with tar and tobacco. A little smoky with intense piney bitterness in the finish. Very heavy handed. Not as much finesse as the Zoigl or some of the other bottled products Ive had from these guys, but still an interesting beer.

On tap @ RateBeer Best Festival. Several pours with Andreas. Somewhat murky, dark brown appearance with a really nice, lasting brown head. The aroma has herbal hops, some straw, some roasted malts, light chocolate, and earth. Medium body. Moderate low sweetness and bitterness. Well balanced. Grassy and herbal hops in the flavor. A touch of smoke. Smooth and easy to chug. Not my favorite Baltic Porter of all-time but this sure was easy to drink.

Zwickel pour at Gänstaller Bräu. Deep brown with a permanent tan head. Intense black lager is malty in the way of roast, milk chocolate, char, ink; hoppy in the way of licorice and spice and herbs and citrus rind, strongly bitter with relatively low sweetness on a rich and savory malt texture, with perfectly fine carbonation. Its just a little young at the moment, with some sharpness to the body, but the core is sound and the effects work.
